definition: to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
towering as a peak

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Putin\'s rise continues to perplex even devoted Kremlin observers.
sentences.chinese: 普京的崛起至今让克林姆林宫的观察家们感到迷惑。

sentences.english: China's rise has been on everyone's lips in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，国崛起成为街谈巷议的话题。

sentences.english: His rise offers little insight either.
sentences.chinese: 他的崛起也没有多少玄机了。

sentences.english: Therefore, the identity transition is an important variable for America to rise in peac…
sentences.chinese: 因此，认同转换是美国实现和平崛起的重要变量。

sentences.english: Of course, many developing countries are envious of China's rise.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有很多发展中国家对天朝之崛起可谓分外眼红。

sentences.english: Once again, opportunistic Imperial warlords pounced .
sentences.chinese: 善于投机的帝国军阀再度崛起。

sentences.english: Why did Europe rise to predominance?
sentences.chinese: 为什么欧洲会崛起并主宰世界？

sentences.english: Similarity thinking is a newly growing up branch of the science of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 相似性思维是思维科学新崛起的一个分支。

sentences.english: Don't you see: Britain and Japan, only three islands, still prosper.
sentences.chinese: 君不见英日区区三岛尚崛起。

sentences.english: The rise of the redback will be a super, true story.
sentences.chinese: 人民币崛起的影响力将是宏伟而真实的故事。

sentences.english: China is very different from most examples of rising powers through history.
sentences.chinese: 中国明显不同于历史长河中崛起的多数大国。

sentences.english: The nuclear industry tactic transferred and the nuclear power grew up rapidly since the reform and opening of China.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以来，核工业战略转移，核电产业迅速崛起。

sentences.english: This situation gave rise to a socialist market economy.
sentences.chinese: 社会主义市场经济应运崛起。

sentences.english: It is the new strategy to stimulate the development of Middle Jiangsu.
sentences.chinese: 加快苏中崛起是江苏再发展的新战略。

sentences.english: A rising global power is beyond debate.
sentences.chinese: 勿需辩论，这是一个崛起中的全球大国。

sentences.english: With the rise of China, a new player has entered the game.
sentences.chinese: 随着中国的崛起，一个新的玩家参与进这场游戏。

definition: to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
(of markets, industries, infectious diseases etc) rising/emerging/in the ascendant
to revive/to rejuvenate
Fuxing district of Handan city 邯鄲市|邯郸市[Han2 dan1 shi4], Hebei/Fuxing or Fuhsing township in Taoyuan county 桃園縣|桃园县[Tao2 yuan2 xian4], north Taiwan
to decline/to wane
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
to rise suddenly/to grow vigorously
development/growth/to develop/to grow/to expand
wave/tides
to expand/to strengthen
nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
